page.title: 03Pendomer & Halstock-Drainage
page.content: The small streams in the area nearly all flow north-eastwards, eventually emptying into Sutton Bingham reservoir The stream which leaves the reservoir (outside this block) joins the River Yeo. Some of these streams rise on the higher ground in the south-east and centre of the area; others come from outside the block, to the south. One small stream in the north-west of the block flows through Pendomer, event- ually joining the River Parrett. The impervious clay of the area makes for surface drainage and much run-off; where a more porous layer overlies the clay there are often springs at its base. Halstock village, in the south of the block, is more or less surrounded by streams and being very flat has been subject to flooding in the past but this has been alleviated by recent improvements in the drainage
